@graph.source-type:name: AER
@graph.source-type:description: aerosol treatment in an atmospheric model where concentrations are calculated based on emissions, transformation, and removal processes (rather than being prescribed or omitted entirely)

@graph.source-type:name: AGCM
@graph.source-type:description: atmospheric general circulation model run with prescribed ocean surface conditions and usually a model of the land surface

@graph.source-type:name: AOGCM
@graph.source-type:description: coupled atmosphere-ocean global climate model, additionally including explicit representation of at least the land and sea ice

@graph.source-type:name: BGC
@graph.source-type:description: biogeochemistry model component that at the very least accounts for carbon reservoirs and fluxes in the atmosphere, terrestrial biosphere, and ocean

@graph.source-type:name: CHEM
@graph.source-type:description: chemistry treatment in an atmospheric model that calculates atmospheric oxidant concentrations (including at least ozone), rather than prescribing them

@graph.source-type:name: LAND
@graph.source-type:description: land model run uncoupled from the atmosphere

@graph.source-type:name: OGCM
@graph.source-type:description: ocean general circulation model run uncoupled from an AGCM but, usually including a sea-ice model

@graph.source-type:name: RAD
@graph.source-type:description: radiation component of an atmospheric model run 'offline'

@graph.source-type:name: SLAB
@graph.source-type:description: slab-ocean used with an AGCM in representing the atmosphere-ocean coupled system
